error.signature: WARNING: The candidate selected for download or install is a yanked version: '<package>==X.Y.Z' (reason: 'critical bug')

verdict.summary: Pip selected a yanked version of a package. Yanked releases are marked by maintainers as broken or dangerous but not deleted. Pip will still install them if explicitly pinned but warns about it.

dead_ends.action: Ignore the warning and keep using the yanked version
dead_ends.why_fails: Yanked versions typically have critical bugs, security vulnerabilities, or data corruption issues

dead_ends.action: Try to find the yanked version on a mirror that doesn't respect yank status
dead_ends.why_fails: The package is yanked for a reason; installing it from a mirror just bypasses the safety warning

workarounds.action: Update to the next non-yanked version: pip install '<package>>=X.Y.Z+1'
workarounds.how: Check available versions with pip index versions <package>, pick the nearest non-yanked version

workarounds.action: Remove the explicit version pin to let pip select the latest non-yanked version
workarounds.how: Change package==X.Y.Z to package>=X.Y in requirements.txt and re-resolve
workarounds.condition: when the pin is not strictly necessary

leads_to.condition: when moving to a non-yanked version introduces dependency conflicts

preceded_by.condition: when resolver backtracking selects a yanked version as the only option

frequently_confused_with.distinction: Yanked versions still exist and can be installed; no-matching-distribution means the version is completely absent from the index
